shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: LOCAL COLLEGE: Scranton men rally past Goucher
shorts.title_distilled: LOCAL COLLEGE: Scranton men rally past Goucher.
shorts.description: After having its 11-game winning streak snapped Wednesday, the University of Scranton men’s basketball team started another one Friday. But it wasn’t easy. The Royals overcame a 13-point halftime deficit to defeat Goucher College in overtime, 74-71, in a Landmark Conference matchup in Towson, Maryland. Trailing, 41-28, Scranton slowly chipped away at the deficit and took a 60-59 lead on a basket by Sammy Tornabene with 5:33 left in the second half. Ben Robinson followed with a 3-pointer, but Goucher hit three free throws in the final 1:39 of regulation to force overtime tied at 62. Robinson and Jon Spatola […]
shorts.content: After having its 11-game winning streak snapped Wednesday, the University of Scranton men’s basketball team started another one Friday. But it wasn’t easy. The Royals overcame a 13-point halftime deficit to defeat Goucher College in overtime, 74-71, in a Landmark Conference matchup in Towson, Maryland. Trailing, 41-28, Scranton slowly chipped away at the deficit and took a 60-59 lead on a basket by Sammy Tornabene with 5:33 left in the second half. Ben Robinson followed with a 3-pointer, but Goucher hit three free throws in the final 1:39 of regulation to force overtime tied at 62. Robinson and Jon Spatola […]
shorts.content_distilled: After having its 11-game winning streak snapped Wednesday, the University of Scranton men’s basketball team started another one Friday.

shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: North Pocono withstands Scranton’s late rally
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: North Pocono withstands Scranton’s late rally.
shorts.description: COVINGTON TWP. — For three-plus quarters, with its defense stopping Scranton, North Pocono built a seemingly comfortable double-digit lead. But shots that weren’t falling earlier for the Lady Knights started to drop and suddenly it became a one-point game. It took two Julia Biko foul shots with 11 seconds remaining for the Lady Trojans to finally secure a 39-36 win Friday night in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball game at North Pocono High School. Ella Clementoni scored 13 points to lead the way for North Pocono (7-1 league, 13-3 overall), which is ranked No. 1 in this week’s […]
shorts.content: COVINGTON TWP. — For three-plus quarters, with its defense stopping Scranton, North Pocono built a seemingly comfortable double-digit lead. But shots that weren’t falling earlier for the Lady Knights started to drop and suddenly it became a one-point game. It took two Julia Biko foul shots with 11 seconds remaining for the Lady Trojans to finally secure a 39-36 win Friday night in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball game at North Pocono High School. Ella Clementoni scored 13 points to lead the way for North Pocono (7-1 league, 13-3 overall), which is ranked No. 1 in this week’s […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 24, 2026
shorts.description: Archbald Sesquicentennial celebration: Archbald Neighborhood Association and Archbald borough are teaming up to host a winter carnival to celebrate Archbald’s 150th anniversary, Feb. 7, 1-3 p.m., 400 Church St. and High School Plaza Park; kid-friendly winter carnival games, crafts, winter story time, fire pits, touch a truck, police demos, s’mores, free popcorn and hot dogs, food trucks, local desserts, hot chocolate and more (rain date is Feb. 14). For information or to get involved, call Kayleigh at 570-351-1086. Luzerne County Scout celebration: Cub Scout Pack 316 and Scouts BSA Troop 316, Avoca, Scout Sunday celebration, chili cook-off and bake sale, […]
shorts.content: Archbald Sesquicentennial celebration: Archbald Neighborhood Association and Archbald borough are teaming up to host a winter carnival to celebrate Archbald’s 150th anniversary, Feb. 7, 1-3 p.m., 400 Church St. and High School Plaza Park; kid-friendly winter carnival games, crafts, winter story time, fire pits, touch a truck, police demos, s’mores, free popcorn and hot dogs, food trucks, local desserts, hot chocolate and more (rain date is Feb. 14). For information or to get involved, call Kayleigh at 570-351-1086. Luzerne County Scout celebration: Cub Scout Pack 316 and Scouts BSA Troop 316, Avoca, Scout Sunday celebration, chili cook-off and bake sale, […]

shorts.title: Medical society promotes health equity and community well-being
shorts.title_distilled: Medical society promotes health equity and community well-being.
shorts.description: In a display of compassion and community spirit, a group of local medical professionals recently traded their scrubs for aprons to volunteer at the St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen in Scranton. Doctors and staff from the Northeast Counties Medical Society spent the morning prepping food items and preparing meals to serve to individuals and families facing food insecurity. This initiative is part of an ongoing outreach program aimed at strengthening ties between health care providers and the communities they serve beyond the walls of hospitals and clinics. From left: Dr. Darlene Ann Dunay, Dr. Elizabeth Gerhardt, Tonyehn Verkitus, Dr. Catherine […]
shorts.content: In a display of compassion and community spirit, a group of local medical professionals recently traded their scrubs for aprons to volunteer at the St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen in Scranton. shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, January 24, 2026
shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSES Elizabeth Elaine Walker, Clarks Summit, and Josselin Stefania Marin-Cedeno, South Abington Twp. Thalia Idalis Blenman and Joshua Luis Martinez, both of Scranton. Kieran Michael Pointon and Michael McCrossen, both of Scranton. Robert David Gwyn and Kimberly Ann Evers, both of South Abington Twp. PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS McRe Properties LLC to Real Estate XYZ LLC; a property at 2513-2515 N. Main Ave., Scranton, for $385,000. shorts.title: Penn State Scranton student wins NFPW communications contest
shorts.title_distilled: Penn State Scranton student wins NFPW communications contest.
shorts.description: Penn State Scranton corporate communication major Zamarra Vrabel, center, took first place in the National Federation of Press Women Communications Contest for a podcast she created for her intracultural communications course. From left: Kelly Conlon-Mazzucca, corporate communication program coordinator; Vrabel; and Stephanie Longo, assistant professor of corporate communication.
shorts.content: Penn State Scranton corporate communication major Zamarra Vrabel, center, took first place in the National Federation of Press Women Communications Contest for a podcast she created for her intracultural communications course. From left: Kelly Conlon-Mazzucca, corporate communication program coordinator; Vrabel; and Stephanie Longo, assistant professor of corporate communication.
shorts.content_distilled: Penn State Scranton corporate communication major Zamarra Vrabel, center, took first place in the National Federation of Press Women Communications Contest for a podcast she created for her intracultural communications course.

shorts.title: AHL: Penguins outduel Hershey in shootout
shorts.title_distilled: AHL: Penguins outduel Hershey in shootout.
shorts.description: The Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins continue to dominate the Hershey Bears. Avery Hayes’s 10th goal of the year tied the game at 3 early in the third period, and the Penguins scored the only goal of the period as they knocked off Hershey, 4-3, on Friday night at the Giant Center. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton owns a 5-1 mark against Hershey, including three straight wins and a 3-1 mark at the Giant Center. The Penguins are one point up on Providence for the top spot in the Atlantic Division, while Charlotte and Hershey are No. 3 and No. 4. The Penguins jumped out to a […]
shorts.content: The Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins continue to dominate the Hershey Bears. Avery Hayes’s 10th goal of the year tied the game at 3 early in the third period, and the Penguins scored the only goal of the period as they knocked off Hershey, 4-3, on Friday night at the Giant Center. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton owns a 5-1 mark against Hershey, including three straight wins and a 3-1 mark at the Giant Center.
